clinical_study.brief_title: Color Doppler and Mri Diffusion in Major Salivary Gland Masses
clinical_study.official_title: Combined Role of Color Doppler and Diffusion Weighted MRI In Differentiation Between Benign and Malignant Tumors of Major Salivary Glands

brief_summary.textblock: This study intend to evaluate the combined value of ADC and COLOR DOPPLER in differentiating benign and malignant salivary gland tumors in comparison to histopathological findings and its use in preoperative prediction of benign and malignant masses.

detailed_description.textblock: the study aim to achieve preoperative differentiation between benign and malignant masses of the major salivary glands using the ADC values and Color Doppler values (PSV - PI - RI)

primary_outcome.measure: The ADC values and Color Doppler values (PSV-PI-RI) of major salivary gland masses
primary_outcome.description: The ADC values and Color Doppler values (PSV-PI-RI) of major salivary gland masses will differ according to the nature of the mass determined by histopathological finding

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients with a suspicious swelling in major salivary glands.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1- patients must be 18 of age or older. 2= patients must have a suspicious swelling in major salivary glands.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with history of metal plates or screws or artificial joints.
2. Patients who have phobia of indoor places.
3. Patients with contraindication to MRI like intra-cerebral aneurysmal clips, cardiac pacemaker, and metallic foreign body at region of examination.
